chapter.title: Data Centers
chapter.para: The data center specific elements which may be contained in the data center description are as follows:

note.title: Element property icons
note.para: The icons used in the properties column of this table are described in

chapter.para:
Element Type Description Properties
storage_type One of ISCSI, NFS or FCP Describes which storage type is allowed in this datacenter
link rel="storagedomains" string A link to a description of the storage domains attached to this data center
link rel="files" string A link to a description of the files available in this data center
version complex The compatibility level of the data center (see )
supported_versions complex A list of the versions to which the data center may be updated (see )
For example:
chapter.screen: <data_center id="d70d5e2d-b8ad-494a-a4d2-c7a5631073c4" href="/rhevm-api/datacenters/d70d5e2d-b8ad-494a-a4d2-c7a5631073c4"> <name>Default</name> <description>The default Data Center</description> <storage_type>NFS</storage_type> <link rel="storagedomains" href="/rhevm-api/datacenters/d70d5e2d-b8ad-494a-a4d2-c7a5631073c4/storagedomains"/> <link rel="files" href="/rhevm-api/datacenters/d70d5e2d-b8ad-494a-a4d2-c7a5631073c4/files"/> <version major="2" minor="2"/> <supported_versions> <version major="2" minor="3"/> </supported_versions> </data_center>
chapter.para: When creating a new data center, the name and storage_type elements are required. Only the name and description elements may be updated post-creation.

section.title: Attached Storage Domains
section.para: A storage domain must be attached to a data center before it can be used. This is done by posting a representation of the storage domain to the data center's storage domains collection.

An attached storage domain has a similar representation to a top-level storage domain, with the exception that it has a data center specific status and set of actions. It also contains vms and templates sub-collections representing the contents of the storage domain, see .
When attaching a storage domain, its ID or name must be supplied. An example of attaching a storage domain to a data center:
section.screen:
POST /rhevm-api/datacenters/d70d5e2d-b8ad-494a-a4d2-c7a5631073c4/storagedomains HTTP/1.1 Content-type: application/xml
<storage_domain id="fabe0451-701f-4235-8f7e-e20e458819ed"/>
HTTP/1.1 201 Created Location: /datacenters/d70d5e2d-b8ad-494a-a4d2-c7a5631073c4/storagedomains/fabe0451-701f-4235-8f7e-e20e458819ed Content-Type: application/xml
<storage_domain id="fabe0451-701f-4235-8f7e-e20e458819ed" href="/rhevm-api/datacenters/d70d5e2d-b8ad-494a-a4d2-c7a5631073c4/storagedomains/fabe0451-701f-4235-8f7e-e20e458819ed"> <name>images0</name> <type>DATA</type> <status>INACTIVE</status> <master>true</master> <storage> <type>NFS</type> <address>172.31.0.6</address> <path>/exports/RHEVX/images/0</path> </storage> <data_center id="d70d5e2d-b8ad-494a-a4d2-c7a5631073c4" href="/rhevm-api/datacenters/d70d5e2d-b8ad-494a-a4d2-c7a5631073c4"/> <link rel="vms" href="/rhevm-api/datacenters/d70d5e2d-b8ad-494a-a4d2-c7a5631073c4/storagedomains/fabe0451-701f-4235-8f7e-e20e458819ed/vms"/> <link rel="templates" href="/rhevm-api/datacenters/d70d5e2d-b8ad-494a-a4d2-c7a5631073c4/storagedomains/fabe0451-701f-4235-8f7e-e20e458819ed/templates"/> <actions> <link rel="activate" href="/rhevm-api/datacenters/d70d5e2d-b8ad-494a-a4d2-c7a5631073c4/storagedomains/fabe0451-701f-4235-8f7e-e20e458819ed/activate"/> <link rel="deactivate" href="/rhevm-api/datacenters/d70d5e2d-b8ad-494a-a4d2-c7a5631073c4/storagedomains/fabe0451-701f-4235-8f7e-e20e458819ed/deactivate"/> </actions> </storage_domain>
section.para: There are two possible actions for attached storage domains - activate and deactivate. See and .

section.title: Files
section.para: The files collection under each data center provides a way for clients to list the files made available by the data center. These files include ISO images and virtual floppy disks (VFDs). When adding a CD-ROM device to a VM, an ISO image needs to be supplied. See for details.
section.screen:
GET /rhevm-api/datacenters/d70d5e2d-b8ad-494a-a4d2-c7a5631073c4/files HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml
<files> <file id="en_winxp_pro_with_sp2.iso" href="/rhevm-api/datacenters/d70d5e2d-b8ad-494a-a4d2-c7a5631073c4/files/en_winxp_pro_with_sp2.iso"> <name>en_winxp_pro_with_sp2.iso</name> <type>ISO</type> <data_center id="d70d5e2d-b8ad-494a-a4d2-c7a5631073c4" href="/rhevm-api/datacenters/d70d5e2d-b8ad-494a-a4d2-c7a5631073c4"/> </file> <file id="boot.vfd" href="/rhevm-api/datacenters/d70d5e2d-b8ad-494a-a4d2-c7a5631073c4/files/boot.vfd"> <name>boot.vfd</name> <type>VFD</type> <data_center id="d70d5e2d-b8ad-494a-a4d2-c7a5631073c4" href="/rhevm-api/datacenters/d70d5e2d-b8ad-494a-a4d2-c7a5631073c4"/> </file> </files>
section.para: Like other resources, files have opaque id and href attributes. The name element actually contains the filename.
